org.jscsi.target.util
Class ReadWrite

java.lang.Object
  org.jscsi.target.util.ReadWrite

public final class ReadWrite
extends java.lang.Object

This utility class contains static methods for reading/writing integers of various lengths and character strings from/to ByteBuffer objects and byte arrays.

Author:
Andreas Ergenzinger

stringToTextDataSegments

public static java.nio.ByteBuffer[] stringToTextDataSegments(java.lang.String string,
                                                             int bufferSize)
Puts the characters in the passed String into an array of one or more ByteBuffers and returns it.

If the String does not end with a null character, one will be appended. If the String's length is larger than the specified bufferSize, all but the last ByteBuffer will have capacity() = bufferSize, the last one will contain the remaining String characters.

Parameters:
string - the String to be put into the ByteBuffer
bufferSize - the maximum size of the returned ByteBuffers
Returns:
an array of ByteBuffers containing the passed String

appendTextDataSegmentToStringBuffer

public static final void appendTextDataSegmentToStringBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                                                             java.lang.StringBuilder stringBuilder)
Appends the content of a ProtocolDataUnit's (text) data segment to a StringBuilder;

Parameters:
byteBuffer - the PDU's data segment
stringBuilder - the StringBuilder that will be extended

writeInt

public static final void writeInt(int value,
                                  java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                  int start)
Writes the given value to the buffer in big-endian format, with the index position of the most significant byte being start.

Parameters:
value - the integer to write to the ByteBuffer
buffer - where the integer will be stored
start - index of the most significant byte of the stored value

byteBufferToString

public static java.lang.String byteBufferToString(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
Returns the bytes in a ByteBuffer as a UTF-8 encoded String.

Parameters:
buffer - a ByteBuffer containing UTF-8 encoded characters.
Returns:
a String representation of the buffer's content

longToBytes

public static byte[] longToBytes(long value)
Splits the passed value into bytes and returns them in an array, in big-endian format.

Parameters:
value - the long to split
Returns:
byte representation of the parameter

writeLong

public static void writeLong(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                             long value,
                             int index)
Writes the given value to the buffer in big-endian format, with the index position of the most significant byte being index.

Parameters:
value - the integer to write to the ByteBuffer
buffer - where the integer will be stored
index - index of the most significant byte of the stored value

writeTwoByteInt

public static void writeTwoByteInt(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                   int value,
                                   int index)
Writes the two least-significant big-endian-ordered bytes of an integer the a specified position in a ByteBuffer.

Parameters:
buffer - where the bytes will be written
value - the value to convert and copy
index - the position of the most significant byte in the ByteBuffer
